general.title: 1. General Information
general.text1: At Lopes2Tech, we take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations—specifically the Swiss Federal Act on Data Protection (nFADP/nDSG) and, where applicable, the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
general.text2: This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your data when you visit our website or use our services.

controller.title: 2. Responsible Person (Controller)
controller.text: The responsible party for data processing on this website is:

serverLogs.title: 3.1 Server Log Files
serverLogs.text: When you access our website, the provider of the pages automatically collects and stores information in so-called 'server log files,' including:
serverLogs.note: This data is not merged with other data sources. The processing is based on our legitimate interest in the technically error-free presentation and optimization of our website.

contact.title: 3.2 Contact Form and Email
contact.text: If you send us inquiries via the contact form or email, your details from the inquiry form, including the contact details you provided there (Name, Email, Phone, Company/Practice), will be stored by us for the purpose of processing the inquiry and in case of follow-up questions. We do not pass on this data without your consent.

booking.title: 3.3 Appointment Booking (Cal.com)
booking.text: We use the service Cal.com to offer online appointment booking. When you book an appointment, the data you enter (Name, Email, Phone, Reason for Appointment) is processed by Cal.com.
booking.note: Please check Cal.com's privacy policy for details on how they handle data.

chatbot.title: 3.4 AI Chatbot Assistant
chatbot.text: Our website utilizes an AI-powered chatbot to assist with inquiries. When you interact with the chat:

list.process: The text you input is processed to generate a response.
list.warning: Important: Do not enter sensitive health data (patient names, medical conditions) into the public website chatbot.
list.providers: Data may be processed by third-party AI providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic) solely for the purpose of generating the answer.

cookies.title: 4. Cookies
cookies.text: Our website uses 'cookies.' These are small text files that are stored on your device.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.text: Necessary for the technical operation of the website.

analytical.title: Analytical Cookies
analytical.text: Help us understand how visitors use the site.

cookies.note: You can configure your browser to reject cookies, but this may limit the functionality of the website.

analytics.title: 5. Analytics and Third-Party Tools
analytics.text: To improve our service, we may use analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics or Vercel Analytics). These tools use cookies to analyze user behavior. The IP addresses are typically anonymized before processing. You can opt-out of this tracking via our Cookie Banner or your browser settings.

security.title: 6. Data Security (SSL/TLS)
security.text: For security reasons and to protect the transmission of confidential content, such as orders or inquiries you send to us, this site uses SSL or TLS encryption. You can recognize an encrypted connection by the fact that the address line of the browser changes from 'http://' to 'https://' and by the lock symbol in your browser line.

transfer.title: 7. Data Transfer to Third Parties and Abroad
transfer.text: We only pass on your data to third parties if this is necessary for the fulfillment of the contract (e.g., hosting, scheduling tools) or if you have consented. Some of these service providers may be located outside of Switzerland (e.g., USA). In these cases, we ensure that appropriate data protection safeguards (such as Standard Contractual Clauses) are in place to comply with Swiss nDSG and GDPR standards.

rights.title: 8. Your Rights

list.info: Request information about your stored personal data at any time.
list.correction: Request the correction of incorrect data.
list.deletion: Request the deletion of your data (Right to be forgotten), provided there are no legal retention obligations.
list.revocation: Revoke your consent to data processing at any time.

rights.contact: To exercise these rights, please contact us directly at

changes.title: 9. Changes to this Privacy Policy
changes.text: We reserve the right to adapt this privacy policy so that it always complies with current legal requirements or to implement changes to our services in the privacy policy (e.g., when introducing new services). The new privacy policy will then apply to your next visit.

conclusion.title: 3. Conclusion of Contract
conclusion.text: Offers made by the Contractor are valid for 30 days unless otherwise stated. The contract is concluded upon:

list.acceptance: The written acceptance of the offer by the Client (email is sufficient).
list.deposit: The payment of an initial deposit.
list.commencement: The commencement of actual service provision by the Contractor with the Client's knowledge.

list.content: Provide all necessary content (text, images, logos) in a timely manner.
list.access: Grant the necessary access rights (hosting, API keys, domain registrar) required for the project.
list.review: Review deliverables and provide feedback within 5 working days. If no feedback is received within this period, the deliverable is deemed accepted.

projectServices.title: 5.1 Project Services
projectServices.text: Unless otherwise agreed in the individual offer, the following payment terms apply:

small.title: Small Projects
small.subtitle: Up to CHF 2,500

standard.title: Standard & Large Projects

recurring.title: 5.2 Recurring Services
recurring.text: Fees for ongoing maintenance or SaaS components (e.g., Chatbot hosting) are billed monthly or annually in advance. The cancellation period for recurring services is 30 days to the end of the month, unless a minimum contract term was agreed upon.

list.rights: Upon full payment of the agreed fee, the Client receives the usage rights for the created software/website.
list.reuse: The Contractor retains the right to reuse generic code modules, libraries, and design patterns developed during the project for other clients (standard software engineering practice).
list.guarantee: The Client guarantees that all materials provided to the Contractor (images, texts) do not violate third-party rights.

ai.text: The Client acknowledges that services involving Artificial Intelligence (AI) (e.g., Chatbots, RAG systems, Voice Agents) depend on third-party providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Retell AI).

availability.label: Availability:
availability.text: The Contractor is not liable for service interruptions caused by third-party API failures (e.g., if ChatGPT is down).

costs.label: Costs:
costs.text: Unless strictly included in a flat fee, variable API usage costs (token usage) may be billed to the Client or paid directly by the Client to the provider.

warranty.title: 8.1 Warranty
warranty.text: The Contractor warrants that the software/website is functional and free of critical defects at the time of acceptance. The warranty period is 3 months from delivery.
warranty.note: The warranty does not cover defects caused by third-party updates (e.g., a WordPress plugin update breaking the site) or unauthorized changes by the Client.

liability.title: 8.2 Liability
liability.text: To the extent permitted by Swiss law, the Contractor's liability is limited to intent and gross negligence. Liability for slight negligence, indirect damages, or consequential damages (e.g., loss of profit, data loss) is excluded.
liability.note: The Contractor is not liable for data privacy violations caused by the Client's misuse of the provided tools (e.g., entering patient data into a non-secure field).

dataProtection.title: 9. Data Protection and Confidentiality
dataProtection.text: Both parties agree to treat all business secrets and confidential information obtained during the business relationship as strictly confidential. The Contractor processes personal data in accordance with the Swiss Federal Act on Data Protection (nDSG).
